title: Effects of Fredonia CB buying bonds from Bank A

content.description:
Include correctly labeled diagrams, if useful or required, in explaining your answers. A correctly labeled diagram must have all axes and curves clearly labeled and must show directional changes. If the question prompts you to “Calculate,” you must show how you arrived at your final answer.

Bank A is a commercial bank in Fredonia with the following balance sheet (T-account). The banking system in Fredonia has limited reserves.

Assets

Liabilities

Reserves

<math alttext="$140,000" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>$</mi><mtext>140,000</mtext></mrow></math>
 Demand Deposits

<math alttext="$700,000" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>$700,000</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

Government Bonds

<math alttext="$860,000" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>$860,000</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
 Owners’ Equity

<math alttext="$300,000" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>$300,000</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

(a) Calculate the required reserve ratio if Bank A holds no excess reserves. Show your work.

(b) The central bank of Fredonia buys <math alttext="$100,000" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mtext>$100,000</mtext></mstyle></math> of government bonds from Bank A. What is the dollar value of the change in the monetary base? Explain using numbers.

(c) Based on your answer to part (a), calculate the maximum change in the money supply as a result of the central bank bond purchase after all adjustments take place in the banking system. Show your work.

(d) Given the change in the money supply in part (c), calculate the change in nominal gross domestic product if the velocity of money is <math alttext="1.5" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Show your work.

(e) Assume the economy of Fredonia is initially at full employment. Based solely on the change in the money supply in part (c), will real output increase, decrease, or stay the same in the long run? Explain.
